alert.note: Alert for Bent; Otero (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 06 at 4:41PM MDT until June 06 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Bent County in southeastern Colorado... Southeastern Otero County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 745 PM MDT. * At 441 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Purgatoire River near Higbee. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1.5 to 2.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Higbee. This includes the following streams and drainages... Alkali Arroyo, Salt Arroyo, Jack Canyon, Stevens Draw, Smith Canyon and Purgatoire River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-2.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
